2.2.title: Mastery Quiz: Areas, Volumes & Triangles
2.2.intro: Test your understanding with these ACT-style questions. Try them without looking back first!

questions.text: A rectangle has a length of 8 inches and a width of 5 inches. What is its area in square inches?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
Area of rectangle = length × width = 8 × 5 = 40 square inches
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: A circle has a radius of 7 cm. What is its area in square centimeters?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
Area = πr² = π(7)² = 49π square centimeters
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: A right triangle has legs measuring 6 and 8. What is the length of the hypotenuse?

options.explanation: This is a 3-4-5 triple scaled by 2! 6 = 2×3, 8 = 2×4, so hypotenuse = 2×5 = 10
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.

questions.text: A cylinder has radius 3 and height 5. What is its volume?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: In a 45-45-90 triangle, each leg has length 6. What is the length of the hypotenuse?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
In a 45-45-90 triangle, hypotenuse = leg × √2 = 6√2
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: A circle has a diameter of 14 meters. What is its area in square meters?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
Diameter = 14, so radius = 7. Area = πr² = π(7)² = 49π square meters
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: A right triangle has legs of 5 and 12. What is the hypotenuse?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is the 5-12-13 Pythagorean triple! Hypotenuse = 13
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: A rectangular box has length 5, width 3, and height 4. What is its volume?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
Volume = length × width × height = 5 × 3 × 4 = 60
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: In a 30-60-90 triangle, if the short leg is 4, what is the hypotenuse?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
In 30-60-90, hypotenuse = 2 × short leg = 2 × 4 = 8
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: A triangle has a base of 10 inches and a height of 6 inches. What is its area?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Area = ½ × base × height = ½ × 10 × 6 = 30 square inches
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

2.3.title: Mastery Quiz: Lines & Slopes
2.3.intro: Test your understanding with these ACT-style questions. Try them without looking back first!

questions.text: What is the slope of the line passing through (3, 7) and (5, 11)?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: What is the y-intercept of the line y = -2x + 9?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
In slope-intercept form y = mx + b, b is the y-intercept. Here b = 9
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: Which line is parallel to y = 4x - 3?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
Parallel lines have the same slope. Original has slope 4, so y = 4x + 7 is parallel
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: What is the slope of a line perpendicular to y = 2x + 1?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Original slope is 2. Perpendicular slope: flip to get 1/2, then negate to get -1/2
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Horizontal lines have zero slope (no rise, all run). Vertical lines have undefined slope.

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: Which point lies on the line y = 2x - 3?

options.explanation: Test (0, -3): y = 2(0) - 3 = -3 ✓. This is the y-intercept!
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is A.

questions.text: If line A has slope -3/4, what is the slope of a line perpendicular to line A?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
Flip -3/4 to get -4/3, then negate to get 4/3
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: A central angle in a circle measures 120°. What is the measure of its arc?

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
Arc measure = central angle measure = 120°

questions.text: A semicircle has diameter 16. What is its arc length?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Diameter = 16, so radius = 8. Semicircle = 180°. Arc = (180/360) × 2π(8) = (1/2) × 16π = 8π
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: A quarter circle (90° sector) has radius 4. What is its area?

questions.text: A circle has radius 5. An arc has length 10π. What is the central angle?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is E.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is E.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is E.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is E.
10π = (θ/360) × 2π(5) → 10π = (θ/360) × 10π → θ/360 = 1 → θ = 360°. This is the entire circle!

2.5.title: Mastery Quiz: Circles, Ellipses & Hyperbolas
2.5.intro: Test your understanding with these ACT-style questions. Try them without looking back first!

questions.text: What is the radius of the circle (x - 7)² + (y + 2)² = 64?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: What is the center of the circle (x + 3)² + (y - 5)² = 36?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
(x + 3) = (x - (-3)) gives h = -3; (y - 5) gives k = 5. Center: (-3, 5)
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: The equation x² + y² + 10x - 4y + 4 = 0 represents a circle. What is the x-coordinate of the center?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Complete the square: x² + 10x → (x + 5)² - 25. So (x + 5) = (x - (-5)), giving h = -5
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: Which of the following represents an ellipse?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Both squared, same signs, different denominators (25 ≠ 16) = ellipse
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: The equation (x + 1)²/9 - (y - 4)²/16 = 1 represents which conic section?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
Opposite signs (+ and -) = hyperbola
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: A circle has center (-2, 6) and radius 5. Which equation represents this circle?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Center (-2, 6): (x - (-2))² + (y - 6)² = (x + 2)² + (y - 6)². Radius 5 means r² = 25
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

questions.text: What is the distance from the center of (x - 3)² + (y - 4)² = 25 to the origin (0, 0)?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
Center: (3, 4). Distance = √[(3-0)² + (4-0)²] = √(9 + 16) = √25 = 5. This is a 3-4-5 triple!
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: The equation x² + y² - 8x + 6y = 0 represents a circle. What is the radius?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
Complete the square: (x² - 8x + 16) + (y² + 6y + 9) = 25 → (x - 4)² + (y + 3)² = 25, so r = 5
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: Which equation does NOT represent a circle?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
D has different denominators (9 ≠ 16), making it an ellipse. All others have equal coefficients.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

questions.text: An ellipse has equation (x - 5)²/36 + (y + 2)²/20 = 1. What is the center?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
(x - 5) gives h = 5; (y + 2) = (y - (-2)) gives k = -2. Center: (5, -2)
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

3.1.title: Mastery Quiz: Algebra Skills

questions.text: What is the value of 20 - 4 × 2 + 5?

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.
Multiply first: 4 × 2 = 8 → 20 - 8 + 5. Then left to right: 20 - 8 = 12, 12 + 5 = 17
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is B.

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.
This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: Solve for x: 5x - 3 = 3x + 11

options.explanation: This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is C.

questions.text: Solve for x: -2(x - 5) + 3x = 18

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.

This is not the correct answer. The correct answer is D.
